item.title: We are all terraformers
item.description: Today is Drawdown Day and it starts with a cool morning breeze, the first one since last week’s heat wave. The radio announces that it’s 7 am as I pass by the basalt statues on my way to work. Although I must have seen them a hundred times, I still marvel at them. Ten tons of sequestered carbon, formed into a row of extinct animals, marching as if they were leaving Earth.

item.title: Climate change reloaded
item.description: When I first learned about climate change, there was plenty of uncertainty and time. It was one of many problems. And it was easy to ignore. Now the game has changed. Here are my main takeaways from studying the current climate landscape at Terra.do. Don’t take them as hard facts, but as an invitation to reconsider and update what you understand and think about climate change. It’s serious. Climate change is happening.
